intro: Melampyrum roseum var. aristatum, commonly known as the aristate touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while the stems are slender and often branched. The species is noted for its unique floral structure and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
